meanings.definition: A person who adheres to a particular style or manner in their behavior or art.
meanings.sent1: The young artist was known as a mannerists for always painting in bright colors.
meanings.sent2: The mannerists of the Renaissance period were known for their exaggerated poses in art.
meanings.sent3: The mannerists at the art gallery all wore matching berets and spoke in rhyme.
meanings.sent4: Her mannerists in the kitchen were like a symphony of flavors, each dish a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The mannerists in the dance troupe moved with such precision and grace, mesmerizing the audience.

meanings.definition: The characteristic style or manner of a particular artist or group of artists.
meanings.sent1: The mannerists of the Impressionist movement focused on capturing light in their paintings.
meanings.sent2: His mannerists were evident in the way he always used bold brush strokes in his artwork.
meanings.sent3: The mannerists of the graffiti scene were known for their vibrant colors and intricate designs.
meanings.sent4: Her mannerists on stage were like a burst of energy, captivating everyone in the audience.
meanings.sent5: The mannerists of the street art world created murals that transformed the cityscape.
